This facility is exhibiting exotic animals such as giraffes, a rhinoceros, and other African hoofstock without a license.
Social media posts from the facility’s Facebook account, dated 6/27/2023 , state safari tours are available with paid
lodging and show photos of guest interacting with the exotic animals.
This facility has sold animals for regulated purposes without a license.
While reviewing acquisition records for giraffes at a USDA licensed facility, the inspector discovered documentation that
shows two giraffes obtained by the licensed facility were purchased from an online auction on 11/24/2021 and picked up
from Ox Ranch on 12/23/2021.
No person shall operate as a dealer, exhibitor, or operator of an auction sale, without a valid license, except persons who
are exempt from the licensing requirements under paragraph (a)(3) of this section. License application kits have been
sent to this facility three times between 2016 to 2022, however the facility has failed to apply for a license to conduct
activities such as exhibiting and selling exotic animals for regulated purposes. This facility must apply for a license and
pass a pre license inspection prior to conducting regulated animal exhibiting or dealing.
The report was sent by email and certified mail.
